comments.body: Too long title. We should probably replace "and Other Metrics"...
We are not estimating it during contribution. Therefore I used "understand" instead of "estimate".

Good! I would rather move the part about streams versus datagrams in the end for political reasons :)
```suggestion
This approach could be used during the Media over QUIC protocol development to:

- compare the independent implementations of the Media over QUIC protocol or perform regression testing of the same implementation,
- evaluate various congestion control schemes considered for implementation,
- evaluate the STREAMS versus DATAGRAMS performance and efficiency.
```
- [ ] TODO: Mention QUIC statistics.
No. Let's start theoretically. Furthermore, I haven't seen Internet-Drafts referencing exact apps or libraries. The draft is there forever. A particular library is here today, but gone tomorow.
Copied from RFC8877.
QUIC STREAM would have several packets, but only one payload that we are going to check.
See RFC8877
all bytes set to zero.

```suggestion
: The remaining payload is generated to form the whole DATAGRAM packet or the whole STREAM (?? what does it mean - I don't like "whole", maybe "complete").
```

```suggestion
In the case of QUIC DATAGRAM, the payload size MUST fit exactly into a single DATAGRAM frame.
```
OFFSET = TD

How about "Estimating Transmission Metrics on a QUIC Connection"?
Or "Understanding Transmission Metrics on a QUIC Connection"?

```suggestion
For live media contribution, where processing of data takes place in real time,
it is important to estimate packet transmission delays and delay variation (or jitter),
to determine data loss and reordering, as well as to calculate other performance metrics {{performance-metrics}}.
```

```suggestion
(??) The lower the observed jitter level, the smaller the decoder buffer needed, and the higher the confidence we can have in a given transmission latency setting.
```

```suggestion
This approach could be used during development of the *Media over QUIC* protocol to:

- evaluate the performance and efficiency of STREAMS versus DATAGRAMS,
- compare the independent implementations of the *Media over QUIC* protocol, or perform regression testing of a given implementation,
- evaluate various congestion control schemes being considered for implementation.
```

```suggestion
for each STREAM or DATAGRAM packet (TODO: ? when sending a packet) to enable the calculation of performance metrics at the receiver side.
```

```suggestion
In the case of QUIC STREAMS, the payload size MUST account for the entire STREAM (?? again "whole).
```

```suggestion
so that calculated latency values are as close as possible to the observed transmission delays.
```

```suggestion
- T_NTP_SND is the NTP 64-bit timestamp value extracted from the payload,
```

```suggestion
at the start of each measurement period, while the smoothed estimate (TD_SMOOTHED) is calculated during the entire experiment (where smoothing is accomplished using moving averages).
```
